title: Aluminum Falls to 2,884.60 USD/T on October 29, 2025
summary: Aluminum prices dropped to 2,884.60 USD per tonne on October 29, 2025, down 0.52% from the previous day, despite a 7.56% increase over the past month and a 10.23% rise year-to-date. The market outlook suggests aluminum could trade around 2,889.07 USD/tonne by the end of the quarter, with a forecast of 3,019.77 USD/tonne in 12 months.

title: Chinese firms drive aluminium expansion in Indonesia, raise surplus fears
summary: Chinese firms are expanding aluminum production in Indonesia, which could lead to a global surplus. This expansion raises concerns about potential oversupply in the market. Goldman Sachs predicts a global aluminum surplus in the coming years.

title: SMM Flash News: Domestic Secondary Aluminum Alloy Ingot Inventory Up 100 mt WoW by Oct 30
summary: As of October 30, domestic secondary aluminum alloy ingot inventory increased by 100 mt week-over-week. Technical indicators suggest a short-term bullish trend for aluminum alloy futures. This reflects ongoing market dynamics in the aluminum sector.

title: LME aluminium cash rises 1.4% to USD 2,750/t as cancelled warrants soar
summary: LME aluminum prices increased by 1.4% to USD 2,750/t due to a surge in cancelled warrants. This volatility reflects changes in the global aluminum market. The rise in prices indicates strong demand and supply dynamics.

title: Aluminum Prices Hit 3-Year High: Is It the Next Key Metal in the Clean Energy Shift?
summary: Aluminum prices have surged to a 3-year high driven by demand from electric vehicles, solar energy, and grid upgrades, prompting investments in renewable-powered smelting hubs globally. The article highlights industry moves by companies like Mercedes-Benz and Apple to secure low-carbon aluminum and discusses policy pressures such as the EU's Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism to accelerate decarbonization. Challenges include transitioning to renewable energy for smelting, improving recycling infrastructure, and ensuring supply chain verification to support aluminum's role in the energy transition.

title: US Auto Scrap Intel Needs Drive Aluminum Market Changes
summary: Enhanced intelligence on auto scrap is critical for improving the US aluminum market by optimizing material recovery, reducing waste, and supporting circular economy goals. The article discusses how better scrap quality identification and recycling efficiency could lead to more sophisticated trading mechanisms, including standardized quality grades and financial instruments for risk management. These innovations aim to transform the aluminum scrap market into a transparent, data-driven commodity market aligned with sustainability objectives.

title: Brazilian Aluminium Can Summit 2025 brings together global leaders to discuss the future of the aluminium can industry
summary: The Brazilian Aluminium Can Summit 2025 features exhibitions and conferences focusing on innovation, competitiveness, and sustainability within the aluminum can industry. The event gathers global leaders to debate advancements and strategies aimed at enhancing the industry's sustainable development.

title: Alcoa Corporation to Host Investor Day on October 30, 2025
summary: Alcoa Corporation is hosting an Investor Day event expected to cover discussions on the company's markets, operations, strategies, opportunities, technologies, and capital allocation. This event may include insights into aluminum technology innovation and sustainability initiatives.

title: Taiwanese Stainless Steel Prices Rise
summary: Taiwanese stainless steel producers have announced price increases for October 2025 due to stronger demand and higher raw material costs. Nickel and nickel pig iron prices have seen slight gains, while Asian ferrochrome prices improved by over 3% in September. Tariffs and geopolitical changes are creating market uncertainty.

title: HRC Steel Price Update
summary: HRC Steel prices fell to $846.08 per ton on October 30, 2025, marking a slight decrease from the previous day. Over the past month, HRC Steel prices have risen by 4.97%. The price has increased by 13.64% over the last year.

title: Galvanized Demand Improves, Price Expectations Rise
summary: Galvanized steel demand has improved in October, with expectations of higher prices in the new year. The price gap between US HRC and most imports has narrowed slightly. The domestic scrap market is expected to form for November shipments.

title: Nucor Raises Prices for Thick-Gauge Rolled Steel
summary: Nucor is raising prices for thick-gauge rolled steel by $60 per ton starting in November. The new theoretical price for standard thickness A36 base rolled products is estimated to be around $1,335 per ton.

title: Algoma Steel Group Reports Financial Results for the Third Quarter 2025
summary: Algoma Steel Group reported its financial results for the third quarter of 2025. The company maintained limited operations to align with market conditions and is transitioning to a new EAF facility, which will increase production capacity and reduce carbon emissions. The transition is expected to be completed by mid-November 2025.

title: FG, Stellar Steel Sign $400m Deal to Boost Local Steel Production
summary: The Federal Ministry of Steel Development signed a $400 million deal with Stellar Steel to boost local steel production in Nigeria. The investment aims to reduce Nigeria's dependence on imported steel and aligns with the government's goal of achieving 10 million tonnes of crude steel production annually by 2030.

title: Germany Announces €6 Billion Industrial Decarbonization Program
summary: Germany has announced a €6 billion program to accelerate emissions reduction in key sectors, including steel. The initiative aims to support the decarbonization of industries like steel and cement.

title: Vattenfall orders the world's first fossil-free steel dam gate from SSAB
summary: Vattenfall has ordered a 120-tonne fossil-free steel dam gate from SSAB, marking the largest steel component ever produced with near-zero fossil carbon dioxide emissions. The gate, to be installed at a hydropower station in Stornorrfors by 2028, uses Hybrit technology and is expected to reduce the project's climate footprint by about 200 tonnes of CO2.

title: Microsoft Signs Seven-Year Deal for Green Hydrogen-Based Steel from Stegra
summary: Microsoft has signed a seven-year agreement to procure green hydrogen-based steel from Swedish firm Stegra, as part of its strategy to decarbonize data center construction. This move highlights the growing demand from tech giants for sustainable industrial materials and supports the broader shift toward clean industry procurement.

title: Copper Prices in London Hit Record High on Supply Fears — Commodities Roundup
summary: Copper prices on the London Metal Exchange reached a record high due to concerns over global supply disruptions and weaker production forecasts from major miners. Glencore adjusted its copper output guidance downward, while Anglo American warned of lower production from its Collahuasi plant in Chile. This has driven three-month copper futures to $11,173.50 per metric ton.

title: Copper Reaches Record High Amid Supply Fears
summary: Copper prices surged to a new all-time high on the London Metal Exchange, with spot copper reaching around $11,137 per tonne. This increase is attributed to supply fears following disruptions at major mines and reduced production forecasts from leading producers.

title: Anaconda Copper Mine 2025: Innovations & Sustainability
summary: The Anaconda Copper Mine exemplifies the integration of digital, automated, and environmentally focused technologies in mining. It highlights AI, digital monitoring, eco-rehabilitation, and rapid automation as key sustainability practices shaping the future of copper mining with a focus on resource stewardship and community resilience.

title: Copper's Green Gold Rush: Demand Soars Amidst Global Energy Transition
summary: Copper demand is surging due to its critical role in electric vehicles and renewable energy infrastructure. EVs consumed 1.7 million tonnes of copper in 2025, with projections to increase by 2.6 million tonnes by 2035. Copper is essential for wind and solar power systems, grid infrastructure, and energy storage, underpinning the global shift to sustainable energy.

title: Battery-powered appliances make it easy to switch from gas to electric
summary: Copper, a company scaling production of battery-equipped appliances, raised $28 million to meet growing demand supporting the electric transition. Their technology aims to improve energy resilience by integrating local energy storage in homes, reducing reliance on fossil fuels and enhancing grid efficiency.

title: Mining for the climate: Chile attracts German investment
summary: Chile, the world's largest copper producer, is accelerating efforts to supply raw materials for the energy transition while aiming to reduce mining emissions to zero by 2040. The country seeks German partnerships to support sustainable mining practices and climate-friendly economic transformation.

title: World Copper Announces Anticipated Closing Date for the Sale of the Zonia Project
summary: World Copper Ltd. announced the expected closing of the sale of its Zonia Copper Project in Arizona on October 30, 2025. This transaction is part of the company's strategic development and exploration efforts in copper resources.

title: Can Innovation Make Ocean Mining Sustainable?
summary: With rising mineral demand, the sustainability of deep-sea mining depends on technological advances and strong environmental protections. Innovations are critical to balancing mineral extraction with ecological preservation in ocean mining.

title: Nickel Prices Rebound Slightly on October 30 as US Fed Cuts Interest Rate
summary: Nickel prices saw a slight rebound on October 30 following the US Federal Reserve's interest rate cut. The SMM #1 refined nickel price averaged 122,200 yuan/mt, up 300 yuan/mt from the previous trading day. This increase reflects market responses to broader economic conditions.

title: Nickel Mines Q3 2025 Slides: Mixed Segment Performance Amid Debt Refinancing
summary: Nickel Mines reported mixed performance in Q3 2025, with cash costs decreasing by 5% to $9,846 per tonne of nickel. Despite a 3% decrease in sale prices, Adjusted EBITDA increased by 20%. The company also achieved record mining ore sales.

title: LME WEEK: Nickel Market Could Stay in Oversupply Until 2030
summary: The global nickel market is projected to remain in surplus until 2030, driven by increased supply from Indonesia. Despite production cuts elsewhere, the market surplus persists due to Indonesia's significant supply share. Chinese imports have supported prices but are seen as strategic stockpiling rather than underlying demand.

title: Nickel Prices Poised to Exit $15K Range as Seasonal Supply Constraints Hit Market
summary: Nickel prices have been range-bound at $15,000-$15,800 per ton since April 2025. However, seasonal supply constraints and regulatory pressures could lead to price increases. Investment sentiment is shifting positively due to electric vehicle demand and government support in Canada.

title: Nornickel maintains 2025 nickel production forecast
summary: Russia’s Nornickel maintained its nickel production outlook for 2025 at 196,000-204,000 metric tons. Nickel production rose by 18% to 54,000 metric tons in Q3 2025, attributed to higher volumes of processed raw materials despite earlier shipment cuts due to seasonal flooding.

title: Nickel Mines Q3 2025 slides: Mixed segment performance amid debt refinancing
summary: Nickel Mines reported a 2% increase in nickel production to 31,148 tonnes in Q3 2025, with improved cash costs and adjusted EBITDA in the RKEF segment. The HPAL operations also saw a 4% production increase, while the company prepares for the ENC project commissioning in early 2026.

title: First Quantum Minerals Reports Third Quarter 2025 Results
summary: First Quantum Minerals narrowed its 2025 nickel production guidance to 18,000–23,000 tonnes after a 44% increase in Q3 nickel output to 5,767 tonnes due to higher throughput and recoveries. The company also reported reduced nickel unit costs reflecting improved operational performance.

title: LME WEEK: Nickel market could stay in oversupply until 2030
summary: The global nickel market is expected to remain in surplus until 2030, driven by strong supply growth from Indonesia and China. Indonesian nickel production is forecast to reach 2.4-2.5 million metric tons this year, with installed capacity potentially hitting 4 million metric tons by 2030, although environmental permit reviews may curb some production.

title: NexMetals Seeks $46.5M Capital Raise to Revive Botswana Nickel Production
summary: NexMetals Mining plans a $46.5 million equity placement to fund the restart of nickel production at its Selebi and Selkirk projects in Botswana. The projects have updated resource estimates totaling approximately 358,000 tonnes of nickel, aiming to revive nickel mining in Botswana for the first time since 2016.

title: Cobalt And Nickel Mining Companies: 2026 Sustainable Trends
summary: By 2026, over 60% of cobalt and nickel mining companies will adopt sustainable extraction methods for battery supply chains. Innovations include AI-driven environmental monitoring, blockchain for mineral traceability, and increased recycling efforts to reduce dependence on virgin mining and lower carbon intensity.

title: Nickel Industry News, Views and Commentary - Chronickels
summary: Recent articles highlight advances in AI to accelerate alloy development and emphasize nickel's role in sustainable value chains from mining to end-of-life. Nickel remains critical for clean energy and EV sectors, with ongoing efforts to ensure sustainability throughout the supply chain.

title: Nano One Awarded C$5M Contribution from NRCan to Scale and Commercialize One-Pot™ LFP
summary: Nano One received a C$5 million non-repayable contribution from Natural Resources Canada to scale production of lithium iron phosphate cathode materials, supporting cleaner and more sustainable battery supply chains. This government-backed funding reinforces Canada's leadership in battery material innovation.

title: Canada G7 Critical Minerals Supply Deals Secure Chains
summary: G7 countries are developing integrated manufacturing networks and advanced processing technologies, including AI and automation, to optimize nickel and other critical mineral supply chains. Environmental impact reduction technologies are being implemented to exceed regulatory standards and provide sustainable competitive advantages.

title: Electric cars may be the 'green' choice, but they're driving a ...
summary: The surge in electric vehicle sales is increasing demand for nickel and other battery minerals, which have significant environmental impacts including high carbon emissions from extraction. Despite this, nickel remains essential for EV batteries, driving innovation in sustainable mining and processing methods.

title: Fostering Industrial Hubs for Energy-Transition Technologies in Africa: A G20 Action Plan
summary: Africa holds about 30% of the world's reserves of nickel and other key transition minerals. The report outlines opportunities for developing local value chains and industrial hubs for energy transition technologies, promoting sustainable production and supply chain resilience through aligned investments and technology transfer.

title: Raising the Issue of Nickel Mining Threats to Raja Ampat Marine Species, IPB University Wins Best Press Release on Sustainability Award at the 2025 Media Relations Awards
summary: IPB University highlighted environmental concerns related to nickel mining impacts on marine species in Raja Ampat, emphasizing the need for sustainable mining practices to protect biodiversity. The press release won an award for raising awareness on sustainability issues in nickel mining.

title: Italy's Tenaris posts 2% rise in quarterly net sales
summary: Tenaris, an Italian steel pipe maker, reported a 2% increase in quarterly net sales, driven by higher sales in North America. The company's financial performance reflects its resilience in the market. Tenaris will discuss these results further in a conference call.

title: Tenaris Announces 2025 Third Quarter Results
summary: Tenaris has announced its third-quarter results for 2025, which include a net sales figure of $2.978 billion and an operating income of $597 million. The company will hold a conference call to discuss these results. The financial performance highlights Tenaris's ongoing operations and strategic initiatives.

title: Tenaris Announces 2025 Third Quarter Results
summary: Tenaris reported its third-quarter results with net sales of $2.978 billion, operating income of $597 million, and shareholders' net income of $446 million. The company's EBITDA was $753 million, and it approved an interim dividend of $0.29 per share. Tenaris also completed a significant share buyback program.

title: Tenaris Announces 2025 Third Quarter Results
summary: Tenaris has released its third-quarter results for 2025, which will be discussed in a conference call. The company's financial performance includes various operational metrics and strategic updates. The call will provide further insights into Tenaris's current market position and future outlook.

title: Tenaris completes USD600 million First Tranche of its Share Buyback Program
summary: Tenaris completed the first tranche of its share buyback program, amounting to $600 million. This move reflects the company's strategic financial management and commitment to shareholder value. The buyback is part of a broader strategy to optimize its capital structure.

title: Prysmian Awarded The Italy-Tunisia Interconnection
summary: Prysmian has been awarded the tender for the construction of the submarine power interconnection between Italy and Tunisia under the Elmed Project. This project aims to create an energy bridge between Europe and Africa, enhancing energy security. The contract could reach a value of around €460 million.

title: Prysmian Named As Preferred Bidder For Major UK High Voltage Energy Interconnection Project
summary: Prysmian has been named as the preferred bidder for a major UK high voltage energy interconnection project. This reflects Prysmian's expertise in high voltage cable solutions.

title: Prysmian Could Be a Relative Winner From Trump's Copper Tariff
summary: Prysmian could benefit from President Trump's proposed copper tariff due to its vertically integrated copper operation in the U.S. This gives Prysmian a competitive edge over smaller players.
